alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 10:32AM MST until July 14 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Burn Scar in... near Flagstaff Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 130 PM MST. * At 1032 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Burn Scar. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Government Tank Drainage. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Timberline, Hutchison Acres and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 424 and 427. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
